sections.title: Introduction & Role Context
sections.goal: Establish the interviewee's background in MLOps and feature store work within Phoenix Feature Store project.
sample_questions: Can you walk me through your role as an MLOps Engineer on the Phoenix Feature Store project?
What aspects of online/offline feature serving are you most involved with?
How does your work align with Novereon Systems GmbH's values like 'Safety First' and 'Evidence over Hype'?

sections.title: Feature Serving Architecture
sections.goal: Explore the technical and architectural design of the feature store, including serving patterns and integration points.
sample_questions: Could you describe the current architecture for online and offline feature serving?
What are the main data sources and how are they ingested into the feature store?
How do you ensure consistency between online and offline features, especially under high load?

sections.title: Model CI/CD Integration
sections.goal: Understand how model training and deployment pipelines integrate with the feature store.
sample_questions: How is the feature store integrated into your model CI/CD workflow?
Can you give an example of a recent model deployment and how the feature store played a role?
What runbooks or RFCs guide your CI/CD processes for models using Phoenix Feature Store?

sections.title: Drift Monitoring & Detection
sections.goal: Discuss the methods and tools for detecting and mitigating feature or model drift.
sample_questions: What mechanisms are in place to monitor for data or concept drift in Phoenix?
Can you walk me through a recent drift incident and how it was handled?
How do you balance sensitivity and false positives in drift detection?

sections.title: Cross-Project Dependencies
sections.goal: Identify dependencies with other Novereon projects and their implications.
sample_questions: How does Phoenix Feature Store interact with the Helios Datalake or Mercury Messaging projects?
What challenges arise from these integrations, and how do you address them?
Can you describe a scenario where a change in another system impacted Phoenix?

sections.title: Risk Management & Trade-offs
sections.goal: Evaluate decisions, risks, and trade-offs made during the project with supporting evidence.
sample_questions: What was a significant trade-off you had to make in the feature store design, and why?
How do you mitigate the risk of serving stale or incorrect features in production?
Could you reference any runbooks, tickets, or RFCs that influenced these decisions?

sections.title: Future Improvements & Lessons Learned
sections.goal: Reflect on the project's progress and identify opportunities for improvement.
sample_questions: What lessons have you learned from building Phoenix Feature Store so far?
What features or capabilities do you plan to add next?
How will these improvements address current limitations or risks?
